headline: NBC changes beloved NBA broadcast format, confuses fans
summary: Major sports league contracts don't change hands often. But on Oct. 21, Comcast's (CMCSA) NBCUniversal wrested the U.S.'s second most-popular — and fastest-growing worldwide — league out of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) subsidiary TNT's hands. NBC Universal's broadcast of its first NBA game in 23 ...

headline: Hasbro tops Q3 estimates, CEO talks cheery outlook on toy sales
summary: Toy giant Hasbro (HAS) topped third quarter estimates with adjusted earnings per share of $1.68 (vs. estimates of $1.63) and revenue of $1.39 billion (vs. estimates of $1.34 billion). Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks sits down with Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to discuss the buying power he is still seeing from American consumers across its product lines, the company's forecast ahead of the holiday shopping season, its ability to navigate tariffs, and its collaboration with major companies on toy lines such as Disney (DIS) and Netflix's (NFLX) KPop Demon Hunters. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights Disney and Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Disney and Warner Bros. Discovery pursue contrasting paths to streaming profitability and growth as media giants adapt to evolving entertainment dynamics.

headline: Vivid Seats Launches Lowest Price Guarantee
summary: New program cements Vivid Seats’ commitment to delivering unbeatable value, trust, and rewards for fans nationwide As the official ticketing partner of ESPN, Vivid Seats is rolling out a national integrated marketing campaign for the launch of its Lowest Price Guarantee program with the world’s leading sports entertainment brand. The campaign features real life fans sharing the electric, once-in-a-lifetime energy of live experiences anchored by the confidence that comes from Vivid Seats’ Lowest

headline: BMO Launches New CDRs, Expanding Canadian Investor Exposure to U.S. Stocks, Including Berkshire Hathaway, Meta, Palantir, Walt Disney and UnitedHealth
summary: Bank of Montreal (BMO) announced five new Canadian depositary receipts (CDRs) will begin trading on the Cboe Canada exchange today. The initial offering of these new CDRs has closed.

headline: Disney suffers alarming loss after massive consumer boycott
summary: Last month, Disney (DIS) found itself in hot water after it made the drastic decision to temporarily suspend late-night talk show “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” from ABC amid political controversy.
